definition: to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: His business was far from being a bonanza !
sentences.chinese: 他的生意還沒有走紅運。

sentences.english: Side two contains four once and future hit singles.
sentences.chinese: 第二面有四首持續走紅的單曲。

sentences.english: Xiao Ying focused on analysis of once-popular binary default losses and gains.
sentences.chinese: 肖鷹着重分析了一度走紅的二元預設的得失。

sentences.english: The video of Arabella's recitation has gone viral on the Chinese social media.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉貝拉背誦唐詩的視頻在中國社交媒體上走紅。

sentences.english: For stars who borrow dresses, walking the red carpet is even more difficult.
sentences.chinese: 對於那些借禮服穿的明星來說，走紅毯則更爲頭疼。

sentences.english: I guess the video owners think they've already gone viral enough.
sentences.chinese: 我猜測這些視頻的作者認爲他們已經足夠走紅了。

sentences.english: This 5-boy-group soon gained great success in the pop music world.
sentences.chinese: 這支由五個男孩組成的樂隊，在流行樂壇上很快走紅。

sentences.english: She is now a popular actress.
sentences.chinese: 她現在是個走紅的演員。

sentences.english: She became known after appearing on the cover of the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue.
sentences.chinese: 她真正走紅是在登上《體育畫報》的泳裝專刊之後。

sentences.english: Hemmings is enjoying a newfound popularity as a character actor in the movies.
sentences.chinese: 作爲電影界的一名性格演員，亨明斯最近開始走紅。

sentences.english: Pete Wentz, Andy Hurley, Patrick Stump and Joe Trohman of Fall Out Boy pose for a red-carpet photo.
sentences.chinese: 皮特溫茲，安迪赫爾利，帕特里克樹樁和喬走紅毯。

sentences.english: The latest popular actress is featured in this new film.
sentences.chinese: 這位最近走紅的女演員在這部新影片中主演重要角色。

sentences.english: Now it has become popular during 2011 Spring Festival Gala.
sentences.chinese: 在2011年的春節晚會上他開端逐步走紅。

sentences.english: The popularity of Tan Te is accidental and Gong is definitely more than that.
sentences.chinese: 《忐忑》走紅是個意外，而龔琳娜絕對能夠做得更好。

sentences.english: Thirdly, Buckley was a hit-and-miss singer-songwriter.
sentences.chinese: 第三，巴克利是一個一炮走紅後勁不足的創作型歌手。

sentences.english: Wang's friends shared her works on their micro blogs and she became a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 朋友們在微博上分享了王月的作品，她一夜走紅。

definition: to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
to fight in one place after another
